hints.title: CST+IG as Lattice for Gauge Theory and QFT
hints.content:
622: :label: thm-cst-ig-lattice-qft-main
623: 
624: **Source:** [13_E_cst_ig_lattice_qft.md § 0.2, lines 24-61]
625: 
626: The Fractal Set $\mathcal{F} = (\mathcal{E}, E_{\text{CST}} \cup E_{\text{IG}})$ admits a **complete lattice gauge theory** structure with:
627: 
628: **1. Gauge group:** $G = S_{|\mathcal{E}|}$ (episode permutations) or $G = U(1)$ (electromagnetic) or $G = SU(N)$ (Yang-Mills)
629: 
630: **2. Gauge connection:** Parallel transport operators on edges:
631: - **CST edges (timelike):** $U_{\text{time}}(e_i \to e_j) = e^{-i \int_{e_i}^{e_j} A_0 dt}$
632: - **IG edges (spacelike):** $U_{\text{space}}(e_i \sim e_j) = e^{i \int_{e_i}^{e_j} \mathbf{A} \cdot d\mathbf{x}}$
633: 
634: **3. Wilson loops:** For closed path $\gamma = (e_0, e_1, \ldots, e_k = e_0)$:
635: 
636: $$
637: W[\gamma] = \text{Tr}\left[\mathcal{P} \exp\left(i \oint_\gamma A\right)\right] = \text{Tr}\left[\prod_{i=0}^{k-1} U(e_i, e_{i+1})\right]
638: 
639: $$
640: 
641: **4. Field strength:** Plaquette holonomy (with proper orientation):
642: 
643: $$
644: F[P] = U(e_0 \to e_1) U(e_1 \sim e_2) U(e_2 \to e_3)^{\dagger} U(e_3 \sim e_0)^{\dagger}
645: 
646: $$
647: 
648: for plaquette $P = (e_0, e_1, e_2, e_3)$ with alternating CST/IG edges, where $U^\dagger$ denotes adjoint (reverse transport).
649: 
650: **5. Action functional:**
651: 
652: $$
653: S_{\text{gauge}}[\mathcal{F}] = \sum_{\text{plaquettes } P} w_P \left(1 - \frac{1}{|G|}\text{Re}\,\text{Tr}\,F[P]\right)
654: 
655: $$
656: 
657: **Status:** All components **rigorously defined** through Chapters 13-14. This theorem **synthesizes** existing structures into unified QFT framework.
658: 
659: **Physical significance:**
660: - ✅ First **dynamics-driven lattice** for QFT (not hand-designed)
661: - ✅ Causal structure from **optimization dynamics**, not background geometry
